metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5292 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Memory leak in the Privilege Attribute Certificate (PAC) responder plugin (sssd_pac_plugin.so) in System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) 1.10 before 1.13.1 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large number of logins that trigger parsing of PAC blobs during Kerberos authentication.

notes.Note: sbeattie> according to debian, the responder part is not built, so might not be affected

criterions.comment: sssd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
